9311G0824-d-11-21-93-SOO.Narrative: PORTAGE YARD ASSIGNMENT 4910, WITH ENGINES 4403 AND 4442, 10 LOADS, 11EMPTIES AND 1242 CARS, WHILE TRAVELING EASTWARD AT 5 MPH ON THE EAST LEAD AT PORTAGE, WI, MP 178.0, WATERTOWN SUB, DERAILED ONE CABOOSE. CABOOSE SOO 82 ROLLED OUT OF 5 TRACK. THE CREW HAD KICKED IT INTO THE TRACK, BUT DID NOT SECURE IT. THEY THEN TOOK THEIR LIGHT ENGINES TO 8 TRACK, COUPLED ONTO A CUT OF CARS AND PULLED OUT ONTOTHE LEAD. AS THEY WERE PULLING EAST PAST 5 TRACK, THE CABOOSE ROLLED OUT TO FOUL, SIDESWIPING THE SIDES OF BOTH LOCOMOTIVES AND DERAILING THE CABOOSE ON ITS SIDE. SOO 4403 SUFFERED A SMALL GASH MIDWAY UP ITS FUEL TANK, SUBSEQUENTLY DISCHARGING APPROXIMATELY 10 GALLONS OF FUEL ONTO THE GROUND. THE LEAD WAS PLUGGED BY THE CREW. THE CABOOSE WAS RERAILED WITH THE PETTIBONE FROM MILWAUKEE. BRAKEMAN SIGNED A WAIVER FOR A 50-DAY DEFERRED SUSPENSION FOR VIOLATION OF GCOR RULES A, 103(L) AND 103(M).NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

9311G0826-d-11-22-93-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 1853, WITH ENGINE 4415, 28 LOADS, 13 EMPTIES AND 4000 TONS, WHILE TRAVELING SOUTHWARD AT 2MPHON THE INDIANA MAIN AT TERRE HAUTE, IN, MP 182.0, LATTA SUB, DERAILED THREE CARS. THE CREW HAD SHOVED NORTHWARD OVER THE SWITCH, A TRAILING POINT MOVEMENT, ABOUT 14 CAR LENGTHS TOTIE ONTO A CUT OF CARS. AFTER MAKING THE COUPLING, THEY THEN PROCEEDEDTO PULL THE CARS SOUTHWARD. THE DERAILMENT OCCURREDAFTER APPROXIMATELY 13 CARS HAD MOVED SOUTHWARD OVER THE SWITCH. THE CONDUCTOR WAS IN THE CABOOSE WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. THEY TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY 100 FT PAST THE SWITCH BEFORE STOPPING. THERE WERE NO SIGNS OF THESWITCH BEING RUN THROUGH. THE TARGETS WERE ALIGNED PROPERLY AND THE TRAILING SET OF TRUCKS OF THE FIRST CAR DERAILED WENT THE ROUTE THAT THESWITCH WAS LINED FOR. HALEY BROTHERS WAS CALLED TO RERAIL THE CARS. NODISCIPLINARY ACTION WAS TAKEN.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
